author: Prathibha Joy
title: A comedy with a socially-relevant message
text:
Director Madhu Chandra is upbeat about his film Vascodigama, produced by Ashwin Creations, which releases on Friday, as it deals with one of his favourite subjects â€” issues in the Indian education system.
The film stars Kishore and Parvathy Nair in the lead, and was extensively shot on college campuses in Sullia, near Mangaluru, with actual students filling in as extras on set. The objective of the film, says the filmmaker, is to make audiences sit up and take notice of corruption in the education system and the irrelevance of its academics-driven nature. "Vascodigama deals with a rather heavy subject, but we have explored it in a humorous manner, so that it does not become preachy. Yes, we want people to discuss the futility of much of what is taught in our schools and colleges, and maybe even initiate a change, but in doing so we want to entertain them," says the filmmaker.
For this, he got Kishore, who is known for his more serious powerhouse performances, to slip into a comedy and play a crazy, loud lecturer. Parvathy also is a teacher in the film, and the romance between the lead pair is the central line of the story, with all other issues that Madhu wants to tackle making up for the rest of the tale. Add to that music by Poornachandra Tejaswi and background score by Ajaneesh Loknath (of Ulidavaru Kandanthe and RangiTaranga) and you have a complete package, says Madhu.
